_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Kauai Coffee Risk Management Plan

Reviewed by:  F.Cowell, J.Uribe, J.Ching

Reviewed on:  03/10/2021



Contents

1.    Emergency Evacuation Plan

2.    Critical Operations

3.    Methods to Account for Kauai Coffee Company Employees

4.    Rescue and Medical Duties

5.    Means of Reporting Emergencies

6.    Company Representative(s) Responsible for Plan

7.    Appendix

     - Emergency Evacuation Map

     - Spill Incident Reporting Form  





Kauai Coffee Company, LLC (KCOF) maintains a number of buildings and facilities throughout its3,100 acre plantation that include the Maintenance and Machine Shops, Electric Shop, Factory Lab, Kanani and Pali Uli Milling buildings, Orchard buildings, Main Office, and Visitor Center.

Although Kauai Coffee Company takes precautions to prevent them, emergencies do occur. When they do, they require quick, correct and decisive responses.  Employees have been informed of the company's planned response to emergency situations, and they are expected to adhere to these guidelines.

1.    Emergency Evacuation Plan

    For any spills or accidental release of a hazardous substance, employees will follow plans specific to the substance that has been released.

2.    Critical Operations

     If any emergency occurs on a project involving propane, combustion engine equipment or electrical tools, Kauai Coffee Employees will shut off propane sources at the cylinders and turn off all equipment before evacuating, provided employee safety is not jeopardized by doing so. 



Planning / Questions to discuss:

?    Does this project involve the use of propane?  Yes or No?

?    Does this project involve the use of combustion engine equipment?      Yes or No?

?    Does this project involve the use of electrical tools or other ignition sources?  Yes or No?

?    Does this project involve the use of other critical operations not listed?      Yes or No?



     If our employees are not able to shut off propane supplies, the fire department or other responding emergency agency will be notified of t

he presence and locations of the propane tanks.



     List locations of propane on this site:

1.      Visitor Center (east): (1) 499 gal tanks

2.      Electric Shop area (north):  12,000 gal 

3.      Kanani Mill area (east):  1,150 gal

4.      Main office (east):  499 gal

5.      Roast Plant (north):  499 gal



    -For accidental chemical, gasoline, or diesel fuel spills, employees shall follow all product labels.  As a precaution, chemicals are stored on spill pans, trays, or containment areas.  Employees who mix chemicals also pour over a spill pan to minimize the potential for spills.  However, as a worst case scenario, the spill of pesticide will be corrected as follows:



1.    Control the spill at its source

2.    Contain the spill to prevent from spreading or contaminating soil from entering sewage and drainage systems or any body of water

3.    Clean up spill immediately, observing precautions outlined in chemical SDS.

4.    Cover entire spill with absorbing material and place into compatible disposal container.  Scrub area with hard water detergent (e.g. commercial products such as Tide, Joy, Spic and Span, etc.)

5.    Pick up wash liquid with additional absorbent and place into compatible disposal container

6.    Once all material is cleaned up and placed in a disposal container, arrange for disposal.



For spills related to gasoline and/or diesel fuel, a Spill Prevention, Control, and Countermeasures (SPCC) plan is in place.



Training for pesticide safety and Worker Protection Standard will be done on an annual basis for all employees with potential exposure to chemical hazards.



Employees who mix and apply chemicals are monitored an on a daily basis with occasional observations by department supervisor and/or manager.



    -  Accidental release:  During the past 5 years, Kauai Coffee has not had an accident involving an accidental release.



 List locations of pesticides on this site:

1.      Weed control department storage



 List locations of diesel fuel on this site:

1.

Con-vault: 1,000 gal

2.      Diesel (Truck) : 5,000 gal



 List locations of gasoline on this site:

1.      Con-vault:  1,000 gal



3.    Methods to Account for Kauai Coffee Company Employees

     Employees have been instructed to meet at a designated location so that they can be accounted for. If it is determined that any employees are missing, the responding emergency agency will be notified. The agency also will be informed about the last approximate whereabouts of missing employees.



     The meeting location will be chosen based on the type of emergency involved. The supervisor/manager will account for wind direction and potential hazards in determining the meeting place at any of the four Evacuation Assembly Areas.

?    Main office (2)

?    Factory (1)

?    Visitor Center (1)

4.    Rescue and Medical Duties

    Kauai Coffee employees from each department and each shift have been specifically trained to attend to injured employees.  Those employees trained in CPR/First Aid/AED operations will perform duties 

        according to the training they have received.  The remaining employees will meet at the designated meeting area (when applicable).

5.    Means of Reporting Emergencies

     When a fire or emergency occurs it is our intention to notify all employees, affected contractors, building owners and homeowners/Camps about the crisis. 



     The first call will be made to the local fire department by using 911.  Other emergency telephone numbers are included in this plan.



      For fire or other emergencies requiring evacuation, Siren Notification Public Announcement (P.A.) Alarm System and similar will be used.

6.    Company Representative(s) Responsible for Plan

      Area supervisor and/or manger is the responsible person to contact with any questions regarding this plan.  If additional information is needed, the Safety Manager or General Manager should be contacted.

The release of any hazardous substance to the environment above the designated reportable quantity (RQ) must be immediately reported to the following agencies:

?    National Response Center        (800) 424-8802

?    Department of Health (Honolulu)    (808) 586-4249

                        (808) 247-2191 (after hours)

?       Kauai Fire Department         241-6508 (or call 911)



The Environmental Affairs Specialist shall make all release reports unless he cannot be immediately contacted.  All reports must be documented (record the date and time and the name of the person who took the report), and the information forwarded to Environmental Affairs.  The lists of hazardous substances and their reportable quantities are found at 40 CFR Parts 302 and 355.  

The reportable quantity for oil is 25 gallons.  Oil spills are not required to be reported to the National Response Center unless the release reaches or threatens a waterway or shoreline.

Other Reporting Requirements

?    The release of any pollutant (including mill water) to state waters must be reported to the National

Response Center immediately and to the Department of Health Clean Water Branch ((808) 586-4309) within 

        24 hours.

?    Certain releases of Department of Transportation (DOT) regulated hazardous materials during transportation (including loading, unloading, and temporary storage) must be reported to the Department of 

        Transportation ((800) 424-8802) "at the earliest possible moment".  See 49 CFR Sections 171.15 and 171.16, or contact Environmental Affairs, for guidance on DOT reporting requirements.
